recognize ： 指所辨认的人或物多是以前所熟悉的。
make out ： 通常指通过人的感觉器官来辨别事物。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (in the sense 'treat as being identical with'): from medieval Latin identificare, from late Latin identitas (see identity) + Latin -ficare (from facere 'make')

entry.def: If you can identify someone or something, you are able to recognize them or distinguish them from others.

example.ex: There are a number of distinguishing characteristics by which you can identify a Hollywood epic...
example.tran: 好莱坞的史诗大片有着一些与众不同的特点。

example.ex: I tried to identify her perfume...
example.tran: 我试图分辨出她用哪种香水。

entry.def: If you identify someone or something, you name them or say who or what they are.

example.ex: Police have already identified around 10 murder suspects...
example.tran: 警方已经确认了约10名谋杀案疑凶。

example.ex: The reporters identified one of the six Americans as an Army Specialist...
example.tran: 记者们认出6名美国人中有一位是陆军技术兵。

entry.def: If you identify something, you discover or notice its existence.

example.ex: Scientists claim to have identified natural substances with cancer-combating properties...
example.tran: 科学家们声称已经发现自然界的某些物质具有抗癌特性。

example.ex: Having identified the problem, the question arises of how to overcome it.
example.tran: 发现问题后，如何克服它的问题又出现了。

entry.def: If a particular thing identifies someone or something, it makes them easy to recognize, by making them different in some way.

example.ex: She wore a little nurse's hat on her head to identify her...
example.tran: 她头戴一顶小护士帽，很容易辨认。

example.ex: His boots and purple beret identify him as commanding the Scottish Paratroops.
example.tran: 他的长靴和紫色贝雷帽表明他统领着苏格兰伞兵部队。

entry.def: If you identify with someone or something, you feel that you understand them or their feelings and ideas.

example.ex: She would only play a role if she could identify with the character...
example.tran: 她只愿扮演她能认同的角色。

example.ex: I could speak their language and identify with their problems because I had been there myself.
example.tran: 我会讲他们的语言，能体会他们的难处，因为我自己曾在那里呆过。

entry.tran: 把…(与…密)切联系;认为…(与…)有关联
entry.def: If you identify one person or thing with another, you think that they are closely associated or involved in some way.

example.ex: She hates playing the sweet, passive women that audiences identify her with...
example.tran: 她讨厌扮演那些漂亮可爱、消极被动的女人，观众们已把她定型为这类角色。

example.ex: The candidates all want to identify themselves with reform.
example.tran: 候选人都想把自己与改革密切联系起来。

means.word_mean: 1. recognize as being; establish the identity of someone or something;

sentences.sentence: "She identified the man on the 'wanted' poster"

means.word_mean: 2. give the name or identifying characteristics of; refer to by name or some other identifying characteristic property;

sentences.sentence: "Many senators were named in connection with the scandal"

means.word_mean: 3. consider (oneself) as similar to somebody else;
4. conceive of as united or associated;

sentences.sentence: "Sex activity is closely identified with the hypothalamus"

means.word_mean: 5. identify as in botany or biology, for example
6. consider to be equal or the same;

sentences.sentence: "He identified his brother as one of the fugitives"

sentences.en: Would you be able to identify the man who robbed you?
sentences.cn: 你能够认出那个抢你东西的人吗?

sentences.en: She identified her son among a lot of children.
sentences.cn: 她在许多孩子中认出了自己的孩子。

sentences.en: We couldn't identify the stray child.
sentences.cn: 我们不能辨认出这个迷途孩子的身份。

sentences.en: Could you identify your umbrella among a hundred others.
sentences.cn: 你能从100把雨伞中认出你的那一把吗?

sentences.en: She learned how to identify medicinal herbs from a traditional Chinese doctor.
sentences.cn: 她向一位中医大夫学习如何识别草药。

sentences.en: His hoarse voice was quickly identified.
sentences.cn: 他那沙哑的嗓音让人一听就知道是他。

sentences.en: The policeman identified him as the thief.
She identified him as her attacker.
sentences.cn: 她认出他就是那个攻击她的人。

sentences.en: He identified the corpse as the criminal hunted after.
sentences.cn: 他认出那具尸体就是那个被追捕的罪犯。

sentences.en: The children identify themselves with their parents.
sentences.cn: 孩子们支持他们的父母。

means.word_mean: 使等同于；把…看做一致(常与with连用)

sentences.cn: 千万不要把财富等同于幸福。

means.word_mean: 使支持；使参与，使关系密切(常与with连用)

sentences.en: He refused to identify himself with their policy.
sentences.cn: 他拒绝参与他们的政策。

sentences.en: His hoarse voice quickly identified him.
sentences.cn: 他那嘶哑的声音让人一听就知道是他。

sentences.en: Our tastes do not always identify.
sentences.cn: 我们的情趣并不总是相同的。
